net.corda.core.node.services

Interface NetworkMapCache

  • All Superinterfaces:
    NetworkMapCacheBase

    public NetworkMapCache
extends NetworkMapCacheBase

    A network map contains lists of nodes on the network along with information about their identity keys, services they provide and host names or IP addresses where they can be connected to. The cache wraps around a map fetched from an authoritative service, and adds easy lookup of the data stored within it. Generally it would be initialised with a specified network map service, which it fetches data from and then subscribes to updates of.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  NetworkMapCache.MapChange 

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface net.corda.core.node.services.NetworkMapCacheBase

        NetworkMapCacheBase.DefaultImpls

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      NodeInfo getNodeByLegalIdentity(AbstractParty party)
      Look up the node info for a specific party. Will attempt to de-anonymise the party if applicable; if the party is anonymised and the well known party cannot be resolved, it is impossible ot identify the node and therefore this returns null. Notice that when there are more than one node for a given party (in case of distributed services) first service node found will be returned. See also: NetworkMapCacheBase.getNodesByLegalIdentityKey.

      • Methods inherited from interface net.corda.core.node.services.NetworkMapCacheBase

        clearNetworkMapCache, getAllNodes, getChanged, getNodeByAddress, getNodeByLegalName, getNodeReady, getNodesByLegalIdentityKey, getNodesByLegalName, getNotary, getNotaryIdentities, getPartyInfo, getPeerByLegalName, getPeerCertificateByLegalName, isNotary, isValidatingNotary, track

    • Method Detail

      • getNodeByLegalIdentity

        NodeInfo getNodeByLegalIdentity(AbstractParty party)

        Look up the node info for a specific party. Will attempt to de-anonymise the party if applicable; if the party is anonymised and the well known party cannot be resolved, it is impossible ot identify the node and therefore this returns null. Notice that when there are more than one node for a given party (in case of distributed services) first service node found will be returned. See also: NetworkMapCacheBase.getNodesByLegalIdentityKey.

        Parameters:
        party - party to retrieve node information for.
        Returns:
        the node for the identity, or null if the node could not be found. This does not necessarily mean there is no node for the party, only that this cache is unaware of it.
        See Also:
        NetworkMapCacheBase.getNodesByLegalIdentityKey
